sense.name: act with dignity and gravity
sense.examples: In a front page editorial, the Boston Herald solmnized the deaths. The King solemnized this day of mourning. Pru has risen to solemnize this launching.

sense.name: perform a rite with proper cermonies
sense.examples: Their marriages were solemnized by the bride kissing her husband's dog whip. The event was solemnized on the seventh day of creation. Circumstances required this marriage to be solemnized in private. The wedding was solemnized in the recreation room with fellow cooks. Early colonial unions were usually not solemnized by church or state.

sense.name: make grave
sense.examples: The message is to solemnize this football game. This ceremony solemnized our hearts. Certain rules of conduct for warfare have been legally solemnized. They soon solemnized thier bond by giving themselves a name. The president's visit to the store solemized the Christmas season.
